articleinfo.title: Orocos Toolchain &version; Release Series Changes, New Features, and Fixes

article.para: This document provides a quick overview of what changed between the Orocos Toolchain &oldversion; and version &version;.

Please consult the online wiki for all available information about the 1.x to 2.x transition: The Road to RTT 2.0. The Real-Time Toolkit is no longer released as a single entity, but as part of a complete set of tools and libraries for creating real-time applications. See also the Toolchain 2.0 Changes.

listitem.para: This release is binary incompatible with RTT &oldversion;.x. You need to upgrade and recompile all your applications in order to use this release.

On Linux, the 2.0.x releases loaded every plugin or component library which filename had ".so" in it. This version only loads libraries ending in ".so". Also, the previous release ignored symlinks. This release no longer ignores symlinks.
Typegen is still subject to some limitations. Especially, it can't generated TAO transports yet, only OmniORB works. This is being looked at and may be fixed in one of the 2.1.x releases.

The initial UseOrocos.cmake macros have been created for use in application CMake files. They are still in proposal status, but will hopefully mature as feedback comes in. See the Orocos Installation Manual for usage tips.
Calling trigger() from within startHook() is supported again, in order to force executing updateHook() after start() for non periodic components.

Typegen has matured more and now generates code that can be checked into version control systems (no absolute paths). It still imposes some limitations to how your data types may look like. Consult the typegen and typekit manuals for more information.
See also the Scripting section below for improvements on the typenames typegen generates.
Many issues have been fixed, including memory management, which adds a dispose() method to the CSendHandle interface. All users of the corba transport are urged to upgrade to this release.
The DeploymentComponent no longer ignores symlinks when looking for components and only loads files ending in .so/.dll/.dylib etc.
The CORBA deployment component can now also create corba servers directly using the 'corbaComponent' operation (similar to loadComponent).

The TaskBrowser prompt has been simplified and allows 'Matlab' like output suppression using the ';' character at the end of a line. If the ';' character is not used, whatever was typed is evaluated and printed to screen; if the line ends in ';', the statement is evaluated but the result is not printed.
The TaskBrowser now understands a 'help service.operation' or 'help service' command. Which prints the interface of a service or operation.
The TaskBrowser supports readline on win32, if it's installed as a static .lib. Do not use 'rxvt' in combination with readline on win32. Both can not work due to buffering done in rxvt.

appendix.title: About Orocos
appendix.para: Please send your Orocos questions to orocos-users at lists.mech.kuleuven.be .
These pages are maintained by the Orocos team.

For questions related to the use of the Orocos Software, please consult these web pages and the Orocos RTT manuals. If that fails, the orocos-dev at lists.mech.kuleuven.be mailing list might help. Please send comments on these web pages and the development of Orocos to our developer mailing list at orocos-dev at lists.mech.kuleuven.be . All of our lists have public archives ( dev public archive ) .
